Docs

We are building SRCCON in the open and sharing what we learn.

photo by Nate Bolt

Like everything else we do at OpenNews, SRCCON is an event designed in the open and documented as transparently as possible. This page houses our growing collection of documentation and also some of the resources we return to again and again as we work to make SRCCON better for all.

Our Docs

  • Captioning a Multi-Track Conference - How SRCCON Did It
  • Five Things We’ve Learned About Sessions
  • How to Plan a Great SRCCON Session
  • Making SRCCON Good for Humans
  • SRCCON Ticketing: What We Did and Why
  • Why You Want a Code of Conduct & How We Made One

About SRCCON

SRCCON is a conference for developers, interactive designers, and other people who love to code in and near newsrooms. Join us in Minneapolis June 25 and 26 for two days of peer-to-peer sessions built around conversation and collaboration. Keep up with updates @SRCCON.

About OpenNews

Knight-Mozilla OpenNews is a joint project of Mozilla and the Knight Foundation that supports the growing community of news developers, designers, and data reporters helping journalism thrive on the open web. More at opennews.org and @OpenNews.
